title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.1: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) CAPACITY BUILDING

description.narrative: National institutions and civil society organizations have enhanced capacity in Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) programme implementation, which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Wash â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children and their families benefit from safe drinking water, sanitation and improved hygiene practices

sector.narrative: Institutional strengthening/policy support/advocacy/education on integration of climate change concerns

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National institutions and civil society organizations have enhanced capacity in WASH programme implementation

description.narrative: Despite the COVID-19 outbreak and the economic deterioration of the country, UNICEF was still able to use its convening power in 2021 to help strengthen the WASH enabling environment through key initiatives including the implementation of the WASH BAT action plan, the launch of an information management system pilot project and the roll out of Water Safety Planning. In addition, UNICEF supported four trainings which benefitted 110 staff from governorate-level water authorities and sewerage companies. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2022
